          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;right&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;13%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;58&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;right&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;13%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;58&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;tr&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;left&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;52%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;/div&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;right&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;13%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;6&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;right&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;13%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;426&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;right&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;13%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;432&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Consolidation&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
        management of RMCF accounts for the activities of Rocky&#xd;
        Mountain Chocolate Factory and its wholly-owned subsidiary
&#xd;
        Aspen Leaf Yogurt
 LLC. As described above
 on January 14
&#xd;
        2013
 the Company acquired a 60% majority interest in&#xd;
        U-Swirl
 Inc. Prior to January 14
 2013
 the&#xd;
        Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements exclude the financial&#xd;
        information of U-Swirl
 Inc. The management of U Swirl
&#xd;
        Inc. separately accounts for the activities of U-Swirl
&#xd;
        Inc. utilizing critical accounting policies substantially&#xd;
        the same as those of RMCF. Beginning on January 14
 2013&#xd;
        and continuing through February 28
 2013
 the results of&#xd;
        operations
 assets and liabilities of U-Swirl
 Inc. have&#xd;
        been included in these Consolidated Financial Statements.&#xd;
        The Company has consolidated $1
951
092 of assets
 $945
569&#xd;
        of liabilities and a net operating loss of $320
446 of&#xd;
        U-Swirl
 Inc. for the year ended February 28
 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Cash&#xd;
      Equivalents&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company considers all highly liquid instruments purchased&#xd;
      with an original maturity of six months or less to be cash&#xd;
      equivalents. The Company classifies certain instruments with&#xd;
      a maturity of between three and six months to be cash&#xd;
      equivalents because these instruments allow for early&#xd;
      termination with minimal penalty and are readily convertible&#xd;
      to known amounts of cash.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of February 28
 2013&#xd;
      and February 29
 2012
 the Company held a Certificate of&#xd;
      Deposit with an original maturity date of six-months totaling&#xd;
      $108
000 and classified this amount as a cash&#xd;
      equivalent.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company continually monitors its&#xd;
      positions with
 and the credit quality of
 the financial&#xd;
      institutions with which it invests. As of the balance sheet&#xd;
      date
 and periodically throughout the year
 the Company has&#xd;
      maintained balances in various operating accounts in excess&#xd;
      of federally insured limits. This amount was approximately&#xd;
      $4.5 million at February 28
 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Accounts&#xd;
      and Notes Receivable&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      the normal course of business
 we extend credit to customers
&#xd;
      primarily franchisees that satisfy pre-defined credit&#xd;
      criteria. The Company believes that it has limited&#xd;
      concentration of credit risk primarily because its&#xd;
      receivables are secured by the assets of the franchisees to&#xd;
      which the Company ordinarily extends credit
 including
 but&#xd;
      not limited to
 their franchise rights and inventories. An&#xd;
      allowance for doubtful accounts is determined through&#xd;
      analysis of the aging of accounts receivable
 assessments of&#xd;
      collectability based on historical trends
 and an evaluation&#xd;
      of the impact of current and projected economic conditions.&#xd;
      The process by which the Company performs its analysis is&#xd;
      conducted on a customer by customer
 or franchisee by&#xd;
      franchisee
 basis and takes into account
 among other&#xd;
      relevant factors
 sales history
 outstanding receivables
&#xd;
      customer financial strength
 as well as customer specific and&#xd;
      geographic market factors relevant to projected performance.&#xd;
      The Company monitors the collectability of its accounts&#xd;
      receivable on an ongoing basis by assessing the credit&#xd;
      worthiness of its customers and evaluating the impact of&#xd;
      reasonably likely changes in economic conditions that may&#xd;
      impact credit risks. Estimates with regard to the&#xd;
      collectability of accounts receivable are reasonably likely&#xd;
      to change in the future.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At February 28
 2013
 the&#xd;
      Company has $714
222 of notes receivable outstanding and an&#xd;
      allowance for doubtful accounts of $47
782 associated with&#xd;
      these notes. The notes require monthly payments and bear&#xd;
      interest rates ranging from 6% to 8%. The notes mature&#xd;
      through April
 2018 and approximately $618
000 of notes&#xd;
      receivable are secured by the assets financed.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Inventories&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Inventories&#xd;
      are stated at the lower of cost or market. An inventory&#xd;
      reserve is established to reduce the cost of obsolete
&#xd;
      damaged and excess inventories to the lower of cost or market&#xd;
      based on actual differences.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This inventory&#xd;
      reserve is determined through analysis of items held in&#xd;
      inventory
 and
 if the value of those items at cost is higher&#xd;
      than their market value
 the Company records an expense to&#xd;
      reduce inventory to its actual market value.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#xd;
      process by which the Company performs its analysis is&#xd;
      conducted on an item by item basis and takes into account
&#xd;
      among other relevant factors
 market value
 sales history and&#xd;
      future sales potential.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Cost is determined using&#xd;
      the first-in
 first-out method.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Property&#xd;
      and Equipment and Other Assets&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.9pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Property&#xd;
      and equipment are recorded at cost. Depreciation and&#xd;
      amortization are computed using the straight-line method&#xd;
      based upon the estimated useful life of the asset
 which&#xd;
      range from five to thirty-nine years.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Leasehold&#xd;
      improvements are amortized on the straight-line method over&#xd;
      the lives of the respective leases or the service lives of&#xd;
      the improvements
 whichever is shorter.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company reviews its long-lived assets through analysis of&#xd;
      estimated fair value
 including identifiable intangible&#xd;
      assets
 whenever events or changes indicate the carrying&#xd;
      amount of such assets may not be recoverable. The&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s policy is to review the recoverability of all&#xd;
      assets
 at a minimum
 on an annual basis.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Income&#xd;
      Taxes&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company recognizes deferred tax liabilities and assets based&#xd;
      on the differences between the tax basis of assets and&#xd;
      liabilities and their reported amounts in the financial&#xd;
      statements that will result in taxable or deductible amounts&#xd;
      in future years. The Company&apos;s temporary differences are&#xd;
      listed in Note 6.&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Goodwill&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Goodwill&#xd;
      arose from two transaction types. The first type was the&#xd;
      result of the incorporation of the Company after its&#xd;
      inception as a partnership. The goodwill recorded was the&#xd;
      excess of the purchase price of the Company over the fair&#xd;
      value of its assets. The Company has allocated this goodwill&#xd;
      equally between its Franchising and Manufacturing operations.&#xd;
      The second type was the purchase of various retail stores
&#xd;
      either individually or as a group
 for which the purchase&#xd;
      price was in excess of the fair value of the assets&#xd;
      acquired.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company performs a goodwill impairment test on an annual&#xd;
      basis or more frequently when events or circumstances&#xd;
      indicate that the carrying value of a reporting unit more&#xd;
      likely than not exceeds its fair value. Recoverability of&#xd;
      goodwill is evaluated through comparison of the fair value of&#xd;
      each of our reporting units with its carrying value. To the&#xd;
      extent that a reporting unit&amp;#8217;s carrying value exceeds&#xd;
      the implied fair value of its goodwill
 an impairment loss is&#xd;
      recognized. The Company performed impairment testing with no&#xd;
      impact to its financial results for the years ended February&#xd;
      28 or 29
 2013 and 2012.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Franchise&#xd;
      Rights&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        rights arose from the entry into an agreement to acquire&#xd;
        substantially all of the franchise rights of Yogurtini as&#xd;
        described above. In addition
 on January 14
 2013
 the&#xd;
        Company entered into agreements to sell substantially all&#xd;
        of its assets in ALY to U-Swirl
 Inc.
 a publicly traded&#xd;
        company (OTCQB: SWRL)
 in exchange for a 60% controlling&#xd;
        equity interest in U-Swirl
 Inc.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Upon completion&#xd;
        of these transactions U-Swirl
 Inc. operated 12&#xd;
        Company-owned stores and 58 franchised U-Swirl locations&#xd;
        formerly franchised as Yogurtini and Aspen Leaf Yogurt&#xd;
        locations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Insurance&#xd;
      and Self-Insurance Reserves&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company uses a combination of insurance and self-insurance&#xd;
      plans to provide for the potential liabilities for&#xd;
      workers&amp;#8217; compensation
 general liability
 property&#xd;
      insurance
 director and officers&amp;#8217; liability insurance
&#xd;
      vehicle liability and employee health care benefits.&#xd;
      Liabilities associated with the risks that are retained by&#xd;
      the Company are estimated
 in part
 by considering historical&#xd;
      claims experience
 demographic factors
 severity factors and&#xd;
      other assumptions. While the Company believes that its&#xd;
      assumptions are appropriate
 the estimated accruals for these&#xd;
      liabilities could be significantly affected if future&#xd;
      occurrences and claims differ from these assumptions and&#xd;
      historical trends.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Sales&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Sales&#xd;
      of products to franchisees and other customers are recognized&#xd;
      at the time of delivery.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Sales of products to&#xd;
      franchisees and other customers are made at standard prices
&#xd;
      without any bargain sales of equipment or supplies. Sales of&#xd;
      products at retail stores are recognized at the time of&#xd;
      sale.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Rebates&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Rebates&#xd;
      received from purveyors that supply products to our&#xd;
      franchisees are included in franchise royalties and fees.&#xd;
      Product rebates are recognized in the period in which they&#xd;
      are earned. Rebates related to company-owned locations are&#xd;
      offset against operating costs.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Shipping&#xd;
      Fees&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Shipping&#xd;
      fees charged to customers by the Company&amp;#8217;s trucking&#xd;
      department are reported as sales. Shipping costs incurred by&#xd;
      the Company for inventory are reported as cost of sales or&#xd;
      inventory.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Franchise&#xd;
      and Royalty Fees&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Franchise&#xd;
      fee revenue is recognized upon opening of the franchise&#xd;
      store. In addition to the initial franchise fee
 the Company&#xd;
      also recognizes a marketing and promotion fee of one percent&#xd;
      (1%) of the Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory franchised&#xd;
      stores&amp;#8217; gross retail sales and a royalty fee based on&#xd;
      gross retail sales. Beginning with franchise store openings&#xd;
      in the third quarter of FY 2004
 the Company modified its&#xd;
      royalty structure.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under the current structure
&#xd;
      the Company recognizes no royalty on franchised stores&amp;#8217;&#xd;
      retail sales of products purchased from the Company and&#xd;
      recognizes a ten percent (10%) royalty on all other sales of&#xd;
      product sold at franchise locations. For franchise stores&#xd;
      opened prior to the third quarter of FY 2004 the Company&#xd;
      recognizes a royalty fee of five percent (5%) of franchised&#xd;
      stores&amp;#8217; gross retail sales.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Use&#xd;
      of Estimates&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      preparing financial statements in conformity with accounting&#xd;
      principles generally accepted in the United States of&#xd;
      America
 management is required to make estimates and&#xd;
      assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets
&#xd;
      liabilities
 the disclosure of contingent assets and&#xd;
      liabilities
 at the date of the financial statements
 and&#xd;
      revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual&#xd;
      results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Vulnerability&#xd;
      Due to Certain Concentrations&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Revenue&#xd;
      from one customer of the Company&amp;#8217;s Manufacturing&#xd;
      segment represented approximately $4.8 million or 13% of the&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s revenues during year ended February 28
&#xd;
      2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#8217;s future results may be&#xd;
      adversely impacted by a change in the purchases of this&#xd;
      customer.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Stock-Based&#xd;
      Compensation&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;At&#xd;
      February 28
 2013
 the Company had stock-based compensation&#xd;
      plans for employees and non-employee directors which&#xd;
      authorized the granting of stock awards.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company recognized $418
633
 $457
449
 and $413
659 related&#xd;
      equity-based compensation expense during the years ended&#xd;
      February 28 or 29
 2013
 2012 and 2011
 respectively.&#xd;
      Compensation costs related to share-based compensation are&#xd;
      generally amortized over the vesting period.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Tax&#xd;
      benefits in excess of the compensation cost recognized for&#xd;
      stock options are reported as financing cash flows in the&#xd;
      accompanying Statements of Cash Flows. The excess tax benefit&#xd;
      included in net cash provided by financing activities for the&#xd;
      years ended February 28 or 29
 2013
 2012 and 2011 was&#xd;
      $58
377
 $24
962 and $11
195
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;During&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;FY&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;2013
 the Company&#xd;
      did not grant any restricted stock units compared with 4
540&#xd;
      restricted common stock units granted in the prior year with&#xd;
      a grant date fair value of $41
721
 or $9.19 per share. There&#xd;
      were no stock options granted to employees during&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;FY&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#xd;
      restricted stock unit grants generally vest 20% annually over&#xd;
      a period of five years.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company recognized&#xd;
      $381
433 of equity-based compensation expense related to&#xd;
      these grants during&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;FY&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;2013 compared with&#xd;
      $404
563 in&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;FY&lt;/font&gt; &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;2012. Total&#xd;
      unrecognized compensation expense of non-vested
&#xd;
      non-forfeited shares granted
 as of February 28
 2013 was&#xd;
      $282
979
 which is expected to be recognized over the&#xd;
      weighted average period of 1.1 years.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;During&#xd;
      the FY 2013
 the Company issued 4
000 fully-vested
&#xd;
      unrestricted shares to non-employee directors compared with&#xd;
      4
000 fully-vested
 unrestricted shares of stock and 12
936&#xd;
      shares of stock options issued to non-employee directors in&#xd;
      FY 2012. In connection with these non-employee director stock&#xd;
      issuances
 the Company recognized $37
200 and $52
886 of&#xd;
      stock-based compensation expense during FY 2013 and 2012
&#xd;
      respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        weighted-average fair value of stock options granted during&#xd;

        &lt;!--EFPlaceholder--&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;2013&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      fair value of each stock option grant is estimated on the&#xd;
      date of grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model&#xd;
      utilizing the following weighted-average assumptions:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Risk-free&#xd;
              interest rate&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;/div&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;

            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;n/a&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;

              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Expected&#xd;

          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Earnings&#xd;
      Per Share&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Basic&#xd;
      earnings per share is computed as net earnings divided by the&#xd;
      weighted average number of common shares outstanding during&#xd;
      each year. Diluted earnings per share reflects the potential&#xd;
      dilution that could occur from common shares issuable through&#xd;
      stock options and restricted stock units. During 2013
 2012&#xd;
      and 2011
 101
661
 117
437
 and 116
004
 respectively
 stock&#xd;
      options were excluded from diluted shares as their effect was&#xd;
      anti-dilutive.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Advertising&#xd;
      and Promotional Expenses&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        Company expenses advertising costs as incurred. Total&#xd;
        advertising expense for Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory&#xd;
        amounted to $233

 and $302

        years ended February 28 or 29

 respectively.&#xd;

        &lt;!--EFPlaceholder--&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline&quot;&gt;2012&lt;/font&gt; and 2011

        respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Fair&#xd;
      Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s financial instruments consist of cash and&#xd;
      cash equivalents
 trade receivables
 payables
 and notes&#xd;
      receivable. The fair value of all instruments approximates&#xd;
      the carrying value
 because of the relatively short maturity&#xd;
      of these instruments.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Recent&#xd;
      Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      July 2012
 the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB)&#xd;
      issued ASU 2012-02
 Intangibles-Goodwill and Other. The&#xd;
      amendments permit an entity first to assess qualitative&#xd;
      factors to determine whether it is more likely than not that&#xd;
      an indefinite-lived intangible asset is impaired as a basis&#xd;
      for determining whether it is necessary to perform the&#xd;
      quantitative impairment test in accordance with Subtopic&#xd;
      350-30
 Intangibles-Goodwill and Other-General Intangibles&#xd;
      Other than Goodwill. Determining that it is more likely than&#xd;
      not that an indefinite-lived intangible asset is impaired&#xd;
      will require quantitative impairment testing
 otherwise
 no&#xd;
      further action will be required. This ASU is effective for&#xd;
      annual and interim impairment tests performed for fiscal&#xd;
      years beginning after September 15
 2012
 with early adoption&#xd;
      permitted. The Company will adopt the amendments during its&#xd;
      fiscal year ending February 28
 2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The adoption&#xd;
      is not expected to have an impact on the Company&amp;#8217;s&#xd;
      Fiscal 2013 Consolidated Financial Statements.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;


      of Operations&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      accompanying consolidated financial statements include the&#xd;
      accounts of Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory
 Inc.
 its&#xd;
      wholly-owned subsidiary
 Aspen Leaf&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Yogurt
 LLC&#xd;
      and it&amp;#8217;s majority-owned subsidiary
 U-Swirl
 Inc.&#xd;
      (collectively
 the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All&#xd;
      intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated&#xd;
      in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Rocky&#xd;
      Mountain Chocolate Factory
 Inc. (&amp;#8220;RMCF&amp;#8221;) is an&#xd;
      international franchisor
 confectionery manufacturer and&#xd;
      retail operator in the United States
 Canada
 Japan and the&#xd;
      United Arab Emirates. RMCF manufactures an extensive line of&#xd;
      premium chocolate candies and other confectionery&#xd;
      products.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Aspen&#xd;
      Leaf Yogurt
 LLC (&amp;#8220;ALY&amp;#8221;) was incorporated in the&#xd;
      state of Colorado as Aspen Leaf Yogurt
 Inc. on September 30
&#xd;
      2010 and organized through conversion as Aspen Leaf Yogurt
&#xd;
      LLC on October 14
 2010.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;ALY was a franchisor and&#xd;
      retail operator of self-serve frozen yogurt retail units&#xd;
      until the sale of substantially all assets in January
&#xd;
      2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of February 28
 2013 the Company had&#xd;
      ceased to operate any Company-owned Aspen Leaf Yogurt&#xd;
      locations
 or sell and support franchise locations.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On&#xd;
      January 14
 2013
 Ulysses Asset Acquisition
 LLC&#xd;
      (&amp;#8220;Newco&amp;#8221;)
 a wholly-owned subsidiary of the&#xd;
      Company formed in the State of Colorado on January 2
 2013
&#xd;
      entered into an agreement to acquire substantially all of the&#xd;
      franchise rights of YHI
 Inc. and Yogurtini International
&#xd;
      LLC (collectively
 &amp;#8220;Yogurtini&amp;#8221;)
 which are the&#xd;
      franchisors of self-serve frozen yogurt retail units branded&#xd;
      as &amp;#8220;Yogurtini.&amp;#8221;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In addition
 on&#xd;
      January 14
 2013
 the Company entered into two agreements to&#xd;
      sell all of its membership interests in Newco and&#xd;
      substantially all of its assets in ALY to U-Swirl
 Inc.
 a&#xd;
      publicly traded company (OTCQB: SWRL)
 in exchange for a 60%&#xd;
      controlling equity interest in U-Swirl
&#xd;
      Inc.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;U-Swirl
 Inc. is in the business of offering&#xd;
      consumers frozen desserts such as yogurt and&#xd;
      sorbet.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;U-Swirl launched a national chain of&#xd;
      self-serve frozen yogurt caf&amp;#233;s called U-Swirl Frozen&#xd;
      Yogurt and are franchising this concept.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;U-Swirl&#xd;
      has built and operates caf&amp;#233;s owned and operated by&#xd;
      U-Swirl
 Inc. (&amp;#8220;Company-owned&amp;#8221;) and franchises to&#xd;
      others the right to own and operate U-Swirl&#xd;
      caf&amp;#233;s.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;It also franchises and operates&#xd;
      self-serve frozen yogurt cafes under the name&#xd;
      &amp;#8220;Yogurtini&amp;#8221; and &amp;#8220;Aspen Leaf Yogurt&amp;#8221;&#xd;
      as a result of the transactions described above.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s revenues are currently derived from three&#xd;
      principal sources: sales to franchisees and others of&#xd;
      chocolates and other confectionery products manufactured by&#xd;
      the Company; the collection of initial franchise fees and&#xd;
      royalties from franchisees&amp;#8217; sales; and sales at&#xd;
      Company-owned stores of chocolates
 frozen yogurt
 and other&#xd;
      confectionery products. The following table summarizes the&#xd;
      number of stores operating under RMCF and its subsidiaries at&#xd;
      February 28

              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font id=&quot;TAB1-5&quot; style=&quot;MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt&quot;&gt;&lt;/font&gt;Company-owned&#xd;

      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Consolidation&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
        management of RMCF accounts for the activities of Rocky&#xd;
        Mountain Chocolate Factory and its wholly-owned subsidiary
&#xd;
        Aspen Leaf Yogurt
 LLC. As described above
 on January 14
&#xd;
        2013
 the Company acquired a 60% majority interest in&#xd;
        U-Swirl
 Inc. Prior to January 14
 2013
 the&#xd;
        Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements exclude the financial&#xd;
        information of U-Swirl
 Inc. The management of U Swirl
&#xd;
        Inc. separately accounts for the activities of U-Swirl
&#xd;
        Inc. utilizing critical accounting policies substantially&#xd;
        the same as those of RMCF. Beginning on January 14
 2013&#xd;
        and continuing through February 28
 2013
 the results of&#xd;
        operations
 assets and liabilities of U-Swirl
 Inc. have&#xd;
        been included in these Consolidated Financial Statements.&#xd;
        The Company has consolidated $1
951
092 of assets
 $945
569&#xd;
        of liabilities and a net operating loss of $320
446 of&#xd;
        U-Swirl
 Inc. for the year ended February 28

  
  
  
  
  

      Equivalents&lt;/font&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company considers all highly liquid instruments purchased&#xd;
      with an original maturity of six months or less to be cash&#xd;
      equivalents. The Company classifies certain instruments with&#xd;
      a maturity of between three and six months to be cash&#xd;
      equivalents because these instruments allow for early&#xd;
      termination with minimal penalty and are readily convertible&#xd;
      to known amounts of cash.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of February 28
 2013&#xd;
      and February 29
 2012
 the Company held a Certificate of&#xd;
      Deposit with an original maturity date of six-months totaling&#xd;
      $108
000 and classified this amount as a cash&#xd;
      equivalent.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company continually monitors its&#xd;
      positions with
 and the credit quality of
 the financial&#xd;
      institutions with which it invests. As of the balance sheet&#xd;
      date
 and periodically throughout the year
 the Company has&#xd;
      maintained balances in various operating accounts in excess&#xd;
      of federally insured limits. This amount was approximately&#xd;
      $4.5 million at February 28

  
  
  

      and Notes Receivable&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      the normal course of business
 we extend credit to customers
&#xd;
      primarily franchisees that satisfy pre-defined credit&#xd;
      criteria. The Company believes that it has limited&#xd;
      concentration of credit risk primarily because its&#xd;
      receivables are secured by the assets of the franchisees to&#xd;
      which the Company ordinarily extends credit
 including
 but&#xd;
      not limited to
 their franchise rights and inventories. An&#xd;
      allowance for doubtful accounts is determined through&#xd;
      analysis of the aging of accounts receivable
 assessments of&#xd;
      collectability based on historical trends
 and an evaluation&#xd;
      of the impact of current and projected economic conditions.&#xd;
      The process by which the Company performs its analysis is&#xd;
      conducted on a customer by customer
 or franchisee by&#xd;
      franchisee
 basis and takes into account
 among other&#xd;
      relevant factors
 sales history
 outstanding receivables
&#xd;
      customer financial strength
 as well as customer specific and&#xd;
      geographic market factors relevant to projected performance.&#xd;
      The Company monitors the collectability of its accounts&#xd;
      receivable on an ongoing basis by assessing the credit&#xd;
      worthiness of its customers and evaluating the impact of&#xd;
      reasonably likely changes in economic conditions that may&#xd;
      impact credit risks. Estimates with regard to the&#xd;
      collectability of accounts receivable are reasonably likely&#xd;
      to change in the future.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;At February 28
 2013
 the&#xd;
      Company has $714
222 of notes receivable outstanding and an&#xd;
      allowance for doubtful accounts of $47
782 associated with&#xd;
      these notes. The notes require monthly payments and bear&#xd;
      interest rates ranging from 6% to 8%. The notes mature&#xd;
      through April
 2018 and approximately $618
000 of notes&#xd;

  
  
  
  
  

    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Inventories&#xd;
      are stated at the lower of cost or market. An inventory&#xd;
      reserve is established to reduce the cost of obsolete
&#xd;
      damaged and excess inventories to the lower of cost or market&#xd;
      based on actual differences.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This inventory&#xd;
      reserve is determined through analysis of items held in&#xd;
      inventory
 and
 if the value of those items at cost is higher&#xd;
      than their market value
 the Company records an expense to&#xd;
      reduce inventory to its actual market value.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#xd;
      process by which the Company performs its analysis is&#xd;
      conducted on an item by item basis and takes into account
&#xd;
      among other relevant factors
 market value
 sales history and&#xd;
      future sales potential.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Cost is determined using&#xd;
      the first-in


      and Equipment and Other Assets&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0.9pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Property&#xd;
      and equipment are recorded at cost. Depreciation and&#xd;
      amortization are computed using the straight-line method&#xd;
      based upon the estimated useful life of the asset
 which&#xd;
      range from five to thirty-nine years.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Leasehold&#xd;
      improvements are amortized on the straight-line method over&#xd;
      the lives of the respective leases or the service lives of&#xd;
      the improvements
 whichever is shorter.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company reviews its long-lived assets through analysis of&#xd;
      estimated fair value
 including identifiable intangible&#xd;
      assets
 whenever events or changes indicate the carrying&#xd;
      amount of such assets may not be recoverable. The&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s policy is to review the recoverability of all&#xd;
      assets
 at a minimum

  
  

      Taxes&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company recognizes deferred tax liabilities and assets based&#xd;
      on the differences between the tax basis of assets and&#xd;
      liabilities and their reported amounts in the financial&#xd;
      statements that will result in taxable or deductible amounts&#xd;
      in future years. The Company&apos;s temporary differences are&#xd;


    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Goodwill&#xd;
      arose from two transaction types. The first type was the&#xd;
      result of the incorporation of the Company after its&#xd;
      inception as a partnership. The goodwill recorded was the&#xd;
      excess of the purchase price of the Company over the fair&#xd;
      value of its assets. The Company has allocated this goodwill&#xd;
      equally between its Franchising and Manufacturing operations.&#xd;
      The second type was the purchase of various retail stores
&#xd;
      either individually or as a group
 for which the purchase&#xd;
      price was in excess of the fair value of the assets&#xd;
      acquired.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company performs a goodwill impairment test on an annual&#xd;
      basis or more frequently when events or circumstances&#xd;
      indicate that the carrying value of a reporting unit more&#xd;
      likely than not exceeds its fair value. Recoverability of&#xd;
      goodwill is evaluated through comparison of the fair value of&#xd;
      each of our reporting units with its carrying value. To the&#xd;
      extent that a reporting unit&amp;#8217;s carrying value exceeds&#xd;
      the implied fair value of its goodwill
 an impairment loss is&#xd;
      recognized. The Company performed impairment testing with no&#xd;
      impact to its financial results for the years ended February&#xd;
      28 or 29


      Rights&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        rights arose from the entry into an agreement to acquire&#xd;
        substantially all of the franchise rights of Yogurtini as&#xd;
        described above. In addition
 on January 14
 2013
 the&#xd;
        Company entered into agreements to sell substantially all&#xd;
        of its assets in ALY to U-Swirl
 Inc.
 a publicly traded&#xd;
        company (OTCQB: SWRL)
 in exchange for a 60% controlling&#xd;
        equity interest in U-Swirl
 Inc.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Upon completion&#xd;
        of these transactions U-Swirl
 Inc. operated 12&#xd;
        Company-owned stores and 58 franchised U-Swirl locations&#xd;
        formerly franchised as Yogurtini and Aspen Leaf Yogurt&#xd;

  
  
  

      and Self-Insurance Reserves&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company uses a combination of insurance and self-insurance&#xd;
      plans to provide for the potential liabilities for&#xd;
      workers&amp;#8217; compensation
 general liability
 property&#xd;
      insurance
 director and officers&amp;#8217; liability insurance
&#xd;
      vehicle liability and employee health care benefits.&#xd;
      Liabilities associated with the risks that are retained by&#xd;
      the Company are estimated
 in part
 by considering historical&#xd;
      claims experience
 demographic factors
 severity factors and&#xd;
      other assumptions. While the Company believes that its&#xd;
      assumptions are appropriate
 the estimated accruals for these&#xd;
      liabilities could be significantly affected if future&#xd;
      occurrences and claims differ from these assumptions and&#xd;


    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Sales&#xd;
      of products to franchisees and other customers are recognized&#xd;
      at the time of delivery.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Sales of products to&#xd;
      franchisees and other customers are made at standard prices
&#xd;
      without any bargain sales of equipment or supplies. Sales of&#xd;
      products at retail stores are recognized at the time of&#xd;
      sale.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Rebates&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Rebates&#xd;
      received from purveyors that supply products to our&#xd;
      franchisees are included in franchise royalties and fees.&#xd;
      Product rebates are recognized in the period in which they&#xd;
      are earned. Rebates related to company-owned locations are&#xd;
      offset against operating costs.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Shipping&#xd;
      Fees&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Shipping&#xd;
      fees charged to customers by the Company&amp;#8217;s trucking&#xd;
      department are reported as sales. Shipping costs incurred by&#xd;
      the Company for inventory are reported as cost of sales or&#xd;
      inventory.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Franchise&#xd;
      and Royalty Fees&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Franchise&#xd;
      fee revenue is recognized upon opening of the franchise&#xd;
      store. In addition to the initial franchise fee
 the Company&#xd;
      also recognizes a marketing and promotion fee of one percent&#xd;
      (1%) of the Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory franchised&#xd;
      stores&amp;#8217; gross retail sales and a royalty fee based on&#xd;
      gross retail sales. Beginning with franchise store openings&#xd;
      in the third quarter of FY 2004
 the Company modified its&#xd;
      royalty structure.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under the current structure
&#xd;
      the Company recognizes no royalty on franchised stores&amp;#8217;&#xd;
      retail sales of products purchased from the Company and&#xd;
      recognizes a ten percent (10%) royalty on all other sales of&#xd;
      product sold at franchise locations. For franchise stores&#xd;
      opened prior to the third quarter of FY 2004 the Company&#xd;
      recognizes a royalty fee of five percent (5%) of franchised&#xd;

  
  
  

      of Estimates&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;

      liabilities

      liabilities
 at the date of the financial statements

      Per Share&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Basic&#xd;
      earnings per share is computed as net earnings divided by the&#xd;
      weighted average number of common shares outstanding during&#xd;
      each year. Diluted earnings per share reflects the potential&#xd;
      dilution that could occur from common shares issuable through&#xd;
      stock options and restricted stock units. During 2013
 2012&#xd;
      and 2011

      Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s financial instruments consist of cash and&#xd;
      cash equivalents
 trade receivables
 payables
 and notes&#xd;
      receivable. The fair value of all instruments approximates&#xd;
      the carrying value
 because of the relatively short maturity&#xd;


      Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      July 2012
 the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB)&#xd;
      issued ASU 2012-02
 Intangibles-Goodwill and Other. The&#xd;
      amendments permit an entity first to assess qualitative&#xd;
      factors to determine whether it is more likely than not that&#xd;
      an indefinite-lived intangible asset is impaired as a basis&#xd;
      for determining whether it is necessary to perform the&#xd;
      quantitative impairment test in accordance with Subtopic&#xd;
      350-30
 Intangibles-Goodwill and Other-General Intangibles&#xd;
      Other than Goodwill. Determining that it is more likely than&#xd;
      not that an indefinite-lived intangible asset is impaired&#xd;
      will require quantitative impairment testing
 otherwise
 no&#xd;
      further action will be required. This ASU is effective for&#xd;
      annual and interim impairment tests performed for fiscal&#xd;
      years beginning after September 15
 2012
 with early adoption&#xd;
      permitted. The Company will adopt the amendments during its&#xd;
      fiscal year ending February 28
 2014.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The adoption&#xd;
      is not expected to have an impact on the Company&amp;#8217;s&#xd;

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      4 - LINE OF CREDIT AND LONG-TERM DEBT&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Line&#xd;
      of Credit&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;At&#xd;
      February 28
 2013
 the Company had a $5 million line of&#xd;
      credit from a bank
 collateralized by substantially all of&#xd;
      the Company&amp;#8217;s assets with the exception of the&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s retail store assets. Draws may be made under&#xd;
      the line at 75% of eligible accounts receivable plus 50% of&#xd;
      eligible inventories. Interest on borrowings is at prime less&#xd;
      50 basis points or at 5.0%
 whichever is greater (5.0% at&#xd;
      February 28
 2013). At February 28
 2013
 $5 million was&#xd;
      available for borrowings under the line of credit
 subject to&#xd;
      borrowing base limitations. Terms of the line require that&#xd;
      the line be rested (that is
 that there be no outstanding&#xd;
      balance) for a period of 30 consecutive days during the term&#xd;
      of the loan. Additionally
 the line of credit is subject to&#xd;
      various financial ratio and leverage covenants. At February&#xd;
      28
 2013 the Company was in compliance with all such&#xd;
      covenants. The credit line is subject to renewal in July 2013&#xd;
      and we believe it is likely to be renewed at terms similar to&#xd;
      current terms.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      November 2012
 Aspen Leaf Yogurt executed a promissory note&#xd;
      for $2.5 million in order to establish a line of credit for&#xd;
      the funding of the potential expansion of Company-owned Aspen&#xd;
      Leaf Yogurt locations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The line of credit was&#xd;
      guaranteed by Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory
 Inc. At the&#xd;
      request of the Company
 upon the sale of substantially all&#xd;
      assets of Aspen Leaf Yogurt
 this promissory note was&#xd;
      cancelled and no amount is outstanding at February 28
&#xd;
      2013.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      5 &amp;#8211; COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Operating&#xd;
      leases&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company conducts its retail operations in facilities leased&#xd;
      under five to ten-year non-cancelable operating leases.&#xd;
      Certain leases contain renewal options for between five and&#xd;
      ten additional years at increased monthly rentals. The&#xd;
      majority of the leases provide for contingent rentals based&#xd;
      on sales in excess of predetermined base levels.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      following is a schedule by year of future minimum rental&#xd;
      payments required under such leases for the years ending&#xd;
      February 28 or 29:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;80%&quot; style=&quot;FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;tr style=&quot;background-color: #C0FFFF;&quot;&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;left&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;81%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;/div&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;left&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      some instances the Company has leased space for its&#xd;
      Company-owned locations that are now occupied by franchisees
&#xd;
      or majority owned subsidiaries. When the Company-owned&#xd;
      location was sold or transferred
 the store was subleased to&#xd;
      the franchisee who is responsible for the monthly rent and&#xd;
      other obligations under the lease. The Company&apos;s liability as&#xd;
      primary lessee on sublet franchise outlets
 all of which is&#xd;
      offset by sublease rentals
 is as follows for the years&#xd;
      ending February 28 or 29:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot;&gt;&#xd;

          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;11%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;200
826&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;left&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;11%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;206
844&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Purchase&#xd;
      contracts&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company frequently enters into purchase contracts of between&#xd;
      six to eighteen months for chocolate and certain&#xd;
      nuts.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These contracts permit the Company to&#xd;
      purchase the specified commodity at a fixed price on an&#xd;
      as-needed basis during the term of the&#xd;
      contract.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Because prices for these products may&#xd;
      fluctuate
 the Company may benefit if prices rise during the&#xd;
      terms of these contracts
 but it may be required to pay&#xd;
      above-market prices if prices fall and it is unable to&#xd;
      renegotiate the terms of the contract.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Currently&#xd;
      the Company has contracted for approximately $2.2 million of&#xd;
      raw materials under such agreements.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Contingencies&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company is party to various legal proceedings arising in the&#xd;
      ordinary course of business. Management believes that the&#xd;
      resolution of these matters will not have a significant&#xd;
      adverse effect on the Company&amp;#8217;s financial position
&#xd;
      results of operations or cash flows.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Resulting&#xd;
      from the purchase of the franchise rights of Yogurtini
 the&#xd;
      Company may pay up to an additional aggregate amount of&#xd;
      $1
400
000
 which is contingent on financial performance of&#xd;
      the franchise rights over a two-year period.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;12%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;34.9&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

      increase in the effective tax rate is primarily due to the&#xd;
      tax consequences of acquiring a 60% majority interest in&#xd;
      U-Swirl
 Inc.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;U-Swirl
 Inc. and the Company will&#xd;
      continue to file separate income tax returns for each&#xd;
      entity.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;U-Swirl
 Inc. has a history of net losses&#xd;
      and does not expect to realize the tax benefit of those&#xd;
      losses.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The consolidation of U-Swirl net loss into&#xd;
      the results of the Company does not reduce the&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s taxable income for the year. Additionally
&#xd;
      the acquisition of 60% U-Swirl
 Inc. resulted in&#xd;
      non-deductible acquisition related expenses of approximately&#xd;
      $268
000 for the fiscal year ended February 28
&#xd;
      2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Finally
 the Company will recognize a gain&#xd;
      of $222
000 for purposes of income tax reporting
 the result&#xd;
      of the transfer of Aspen Leaf Yogurt franchise rights to&#xd;
      U-Swirl
 Inc.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      components of deferred income taxes at February 28 or 29 are&#xd;
      as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
