              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Net&#xd;
              deferred tax liability&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;/div&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &amp;#160;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;12%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;(253
061&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &amp;#160;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;12%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;(1
397
683&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company files income tax returns in the U.S. federal and&#xd;
      various state taxing jurisdictions. With few exceptions
 the&#xd;
      Company is no longer subject to U.S. federal and state tax&#xd;
      examinations in its major tax jurisdictions for periods&#xd;
      before FY 2008.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Realization&#xd;
      of the Company&apos;s deferred tax assets is dependent upon the&#xd;
      Company generating sufficient taxable income
 in the&#xd;
      appropriate tax jurisdictions
 in future years to obtain&#xd;
      benefit from the reversal of net deductible temporary&#xd;
      differences. The amount of deferred tax assets considered&#xd;
      realizable is subject to adjustment in future periods if&#xd;
      estimates of future taxable income are changed. Management&#xd;
      believes that it is more likely than not that the Company&#xd;
      will realize the benefits of its deferred tax assets as of&#xd;
      February 28
 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company accounts for uncertainty in income taxes by&#xd;
      recognizing the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position&#xd;
      only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will&#xd;
      be sustained on examination by the taxing authorities
 based&#xd;
      on the technical merits of the position.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#xd;
      Company measures the tax benefits recognized in the financial&#xd;
      statements from such a position based on the largest benefit&#xd;
      that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon&#xd;
      ultimate resolution.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The application of income tax&#xd;
      law is inherently complex.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As such
 the Company is&#xd;
      required to make judgments regarding income tax exposures.&#xd;
      Interpretations of and guidance surrounding income tax law&#xd;
      and regulations change over time and may result in changes to&#xd;
      the Company&apos;s judgments which can materially affect amounts&#xd;
      recognized in the balance sheets and statements of&#xd;
      operations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The result of the assessment of the&#xd;
      Company&apos;s tax positions did not have an impact on the&#xd;
      financial statements for the years ended February 28 or 29
&#xd;
      2013 or 2012.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&apos;s federal tax returns&#xd;
      for all years after 2009 and the Company&apos;s state tax returns&#xd;
      after 2008 are subject to future examination by tax&#xd;
      authorities for all of the Company&apos;s tax&#xd;
      jurisdictions.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company does not have any&#xd;
      significant unrecognized tax benefits and does not anticipate&#xd;
      a significant increase or decrease in unrecognized tax&#xd;
      benefits within the next twelve months. Amounts are&#xd;
      recognized for income tax related interest and penalties as a&#xd;
      component of general and administrative expense in the&#xd;
      statement of income and are immaterial for years ended&#xd;
      February 28 or 29
 2013 and 2012.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;As&#xd;
      of February 28
 2013
 U-Swirl
 Inc. was not consolidated with&#xd;
      us for purposes of filing federal income&#xd;
      tax.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;U-Swirl
 Inc. files a separate federal tax&#xd;
      return and has its own federal loss&#xd;
      carryforward.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of February 28
 2013 U-Swirl
&#xd;
      Inc. had recorded a full valuation allowance related to the&#xd;
      realization of its deferred income tax assets.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        accordance with section 382 of the Internal Revenue Code
&#xd;
        deductibility of U-Swirl
 Inc.&amp;#8217;s U.S. net operating&#xd;
        loss carryovers may be subject to annual limitation in the&#xd;
        event of a change in control.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;We have performed&#xd;
        a preliminary evaluation as to whether a change in control&#xd;
        has taken place
 and have concluded that there was a change&#xd;
        of control with respect to the net operating losses of&#xd;
        U-Swirl
 Inc. when the Company acquired its 60% ownership&#xd;
        interest in January 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        estimate that the potential future tax deductions of&#xd;
        U-Swirl
 Inc. accumulated net operating losses
 limited by&#xd;
        section 382
 to be approximately $1.0 million with a&#xd;
        resulting deferred tax asset of approximately $380
000. We&#xd;
        have recorded a valuation allowance for this amount to&#xd;
        reflect the likelihood of realization of this deferred tax&#xd;
        asset.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

822&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;tr&gt;&#xd;

      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Cash&#xd;
      Dividend&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company paid a quarterly cash dividend of $0.10 per common&#xd;
      share on June 10
 2011
 September 16
 2011
 December 9
 2011&#xd;
      and March 16
 2012 to shareholders of record on May 26
 2011
&#xd;
      September 6
 2011
 November 29
 2011 and March 2
 2012
&#xd;
      respectively. The Company paid a quarterly cash dividend of&#xd;
      $0.11 per common share on June 8
 2012
 September 14
 2012
&#xd;
      December 14
 2012 and March 15
 2013 to shareholders of&#xd;
      record on May 24
 2012
 September 4
 2012
 November 30
 2012&#xd;
      and March 1
 2013 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Future&#xd;
      declarations of dividends will depend on
 among other things
&#xd;
      the Company&apos;s results of operations
 financial condition
&#xd;
      capital requirements
 and on such other factors as the&#xd;
      Company&apos;s Board of Directors may in its discretion consider&#xd;
      relevant and in the best long term interest of the&#xd;
      shareholders.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

  
  
  
  
  
  
  

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      8 - STOCK COMPENSATION PLANS&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;In&#xd;
      FY 2008
 shareholders approved the 2007 Equity Incentive Plan&#xd;
      (the &amp;#8220;2007 Plan&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The 2007 Plan&#xd;
      allows awards of stock options; stock appreciation rights;&#xd;
      stock awards
 restricted stock and stock units; performance&#xd;
      shares and performance units; other stock or cash based&#xd;
      awards.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of February 28
 2013
 219
240&#xd;
      restricted stock units
 12
936 stock options and 20
000&#xd;
      unrestricted shares have been awarded under the 2007 Plan and&#xd;
      213
128 shares of common stock is available for award under&#xd;
      the plan consisting of 300
000 shares originally authorized
&#xd;
      85
340 previously reserved for issuance under earlier plans&#xd;
      and 79
964 shares forfeited under the 2007 Plan and suspended&#xd;
      plans
 less shares awarded under the Plan.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Under&#xd;
      the&amp;#160;&amp;#160;2004 Stock Option Plan (the &amp;#8220;2004&#xd;
      Plan&amp;#8221;)
 options to purchase up to 970
200 of the&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s common stock were previously authorized to be&#xd;
      granted at prices not less than market value at the date of&#xd;
      grant. Options granted may not have a term exceeding ten&#xd;
      years under the&amp;#160;&amp;#160;the 2004 plan and the 2007 plan.&#xd;
      Options representing the right to purchase&amp;#160;&amp;#160;258
009&#xd;
      and 12
936 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock were&#xd;
      outstanding under the the 2004 Plan and the 2007 Plan
&#xd;
      respectively
 at February 28
 2013. On February 21
 2006
 the&#xd;
      Company accelerated the vesting of all outstanding stock&#xd;
      options in order to prevent past option grants from having an&#xd;
      impact on future results. The options outstanding under these&#xd;
      plans will expire
 if not exercised through February&#xd;
      2016.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Information&#xd;
      with respect to stock option awards outstanding under the&#xd;
      plans at February 28
 2013
 and changes for the three years&#xd;
      then ended was as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

        &lt;tr&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;

                &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Twelve&#xd;
                Months Ended&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

              28 or 29:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;/div&gt;&#xd;

            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;13%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: right&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;2.99&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td align=&quot;left&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;17.43&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td nowrap=&quot;nowrap&quot; valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;1%&quot; style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: left&quot;&gt;&#xd;

        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;

  
  
  
  
  
  

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      9 - OPERATING SEGMENTS&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company classifies its business interests into five&#xd;
      reportable segments: Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory
 Inc.&#xd;
      Franchising
 Manufacturing
 Retail Stores
 U-Swirl
 Inc&#xd;
      operations and Other.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The accounting&#xd;
      policies of the segments are the same as those described in&#xd;
      the summary of significant accounting policies in Note 1 to&#xd;
      these consolidated financial statements. The Company&#xd;
      evaluates performance and allocates resources based on&#xd;
      operating contribution
 which excludes unallocated corporate&#xd;
      general and administrative costs and income tax expense or&#xd;
      benefit.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#8217;s reportable segments&#xd;
      are strategic businesses that utilize common merchandising
&#xd;
      distribution
 and marketing functions
 as well as common&#xd;
      information systems and corporate&#xd;
      administration.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All inter-segment sales prices are&#xd;
      market based.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Each segment is managed separately&#xd;
      because of the differences in required infrastructure and the&#xd;
      difference in products and services:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=&quot;0&quot; cellspacing=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; style=&quot;FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;tr&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block&quot;&gt;&#xd;

              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;FY&#xd;
              2013&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      information reported in our &amp;#8220;U-Swirl
 Inc.&amp;#8221;&#xd;
      segment includes data from January 14
 2013 through February&#xd;
      28
 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Revenue&#xd;
      from one customer of the Company&amp;#8217;s Manufacturing&#xd;
      segment represents approximately $4.8 million of the&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s revenues from external customers during year&#xd;
      ended February 28
 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      11 - EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLAN&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company has a 401(k) plan called the Rocky Mountain Chocolate&#xd;
      Factory
 Inc. 401(k) Plan. Eligible participants are&#xd;
      permitted to make contributions up to statutory limits. The&#xd;
      Company makes a matching contribution
 which vests ratably&#xd;
      over a 3-year period
 and is 25% of the employee&amp;#8217;s&#xd;
      contribution up to a maximum of 1.5% of the employee&amp;#8217;s&#xd;
      compensation.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;During the years ended February 28&#xd;
      or 29
 2013
 2012 and 2011
 the Company&amp;#8217;s contribution&#xd;
      was approximately $50
000
 $39
000
 and $35
000
&#xd;
      respectively
 to the plan.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      14 &amp;#8211; RESTRUCTURING CHARGES&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;As&#xd;
      discussed in Note 1
 on January 14
 2013
 &amp;#8220;Newco&amp;#8221;&#xd;
      entered into an agreement to acquire substantially all of the&#xd;
      franchise rights of Yogurtini. In addition
 on January 14
&#xd;
      2013
 the Company entered into two agreements to sell all of&#xd;
      its membership interests in Newco and substantially all of&#xd;
      its assets in ALY to U-Swirl
 Inc.
 in exchange for a 60%&#xd;
      controlling equity interest in U-Swirl
 Inc.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Upon&#xd;
      completion of these transactions
 the management of U-Swirl
&#xd;
      Inc. is responsible for operations at all company-owned Aspen&#xd;
      Leaf Yogurt locations and the selling and support of&#xd;
      franchise locations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Associated with this&#xd;
      transaction
 the Company recorded net restructuring charges&#xd;
      of $635
168 as of February 28
 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Restructuring&#xd;
      charges incurred at February 28
 2013 were comprised of the&#xd;
      following:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      15 &amp;#8211; RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      Company has entered into Franchise Agreements and a&#xd;
      Development Agreement with a member of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#xd;
      Board of Directors.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The director operates two ALY&#xd;
      locations under the Franchise Agreements and the Development&#xd;
      Agreement.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;As&#xd;
      of February 28
 2013
 the Company had receivables of&#xd;
      approximately $2
000 due from such director associated with&#xd;
      the director&amp;#8217;s ownership and operation of the two&#xd;
      current ALY locations.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Our&#xd;
      President and Chief Executive Officer has members of his&#xd;
      immediate family with ownership interests in retail marketing&#xd;
      businesses.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These businesses have
 on occasion
&#xd;
      provided services to the Company and may provide services in&#xd;
      the future.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As of February 28
 2013
 the Company&#xd;
      had incurred expenses of $13
850 and there was no amount&#xd;
      recorded to accounts payable that related to these&#xd;
      businesses. Transactions with these businesses have been&#xd;
      immaterial to our results of operations.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;U-Swirl
&#xd;
      Inc. was owed $8
597 and $7
048 as of February 28
 2013 and&#xd;
      December 31
 2012
 respectively
 from a U-Swirl franchisee&#xd;
      that is owned and operated by the grandchildren of the&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s Chief Marketing Officer. The corporate&#xd;
      secretary and treasurer of the franchisee is also the&#xd;
      Company&amp;#8217;s corporate secretary.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;As&#xd;
      of February 28
 2013
 U-Swirl
 Inc. had deferred revenue of&#xd;
      $30
000 from an area developer in which the Company&amp;#8217;s&#xd;
      Chief Executive Officer and Chief Operating Officer have a&#xd;
      minority interest.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

  
  
  
  
  

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      16 &amp;#8211; SUBSEQUENT EVENTS&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Subsequent&#xd;
      to year end
 the Company entered into agreements to acquire&#xd;
      two formerly Franchise owned and operated&#xd;
      locations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company purchased these locations&#xd;
      with the intent of upgrading them to current design&#xd;
      specifications.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Upon completion of the design&#xd;
      upgrades
 the Company intends to sell them to franchisees and&#xd;
      finance the franchisee purchase of the&#xd;
      locations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company acquired the locations for&#xd;
      $105
000 plus the costs of inventory.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The results&#xd;
      of the transactions are expected to have an immaterial impact&#xd;
      on the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

  

      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;NOTE&#xd;
      17 &amp;#8211; ACQUISITION OF U-SWIRL
 INC.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;On&#xd;
      January 14
 2013 the Company entered into an agreement to&#xd;
      acquire a 60% controlling equity interest in U-Swirl
 Inc.
 a&#xd;
      publicly traded company (OTCQB: SWRL).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;U-Swirl
&#xd;
      Inc. is a franchisor and operator of self-serve frozen yogurt&#xd;
      locations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In exchange for our 60% interest we&#xd;
      contributed our recently acquired franchise rights in YHI
&#xd;
      Inc. and Yogurtini International
 LLC (collectively
&#xd;
      &amp;#8220;Yogurtini&amp;#8221;) as well as the franchise rights for&#xd;
      Aspen Leaf Yogurt
 LLC.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;With the addition of&#xd;
      Yogurtini and Aspen Leaf Yogurt we believe that U-Swirl
 Inc.&#xd;
      will have the &amp;#8220;critical mass&amp;#8221; necessary to&#xd;
      achieve profitability.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;We&#xd;
      accounted for this business combination in accordance with&#xd;
      ASC 805 &amp;#8211; Business Combinations
 which requires the&#xd;
      acquiring entity in a business combination to recognize all&#xd;
      the assets acquired and liabilities assumed in the&#xd;
      transaction.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;The&#xd;
      purchase price was allocated as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

913&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

      &lt;/table&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;

          the acquisition date
 the fair value of the&#xd;
          non-controlling interest was $664
612.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#xd;
          fair value of the non-controlling interest was based upon&#xd;
          reference to quoted market valued of U-Swirl
 Inc. stock&#xd;
          plus bargain purchase adjustment of approximately&#xd;
          $258
000 resulting from the allocation of the purchase&#xd;
          price.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Fair&#xd;
        valuation methods used for the identifiable net assets&#xd;
        acquired in the acquisition make use of quoted prices in&#xd;
        active markets and discounted cash flows.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#xd;
        fair value of franchise rights is provisional pending&#xd;
        contingent payment
 as outlined in Note 5
 above.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;At&#xd;
        the same time that the Company entered into this agreement
&#xd;
        we also entered into an agreement to sell substantially all&#xd;
        of the assets held by Aspen Leaf Yogurt
 LLC to U-Swirl
&#xd;
        Inc.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In exchange for these assets
 the company&#xd;
        holds notes receivable (payable by U-Swirl
 Inc.) in the&#xd;
        amount of $900
000
 which are eliminated on&#xd;
        consolidation.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Those assets are carried at&#xd;
        historical cost.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;As&#xd;
      a part of these transactions we recognized $635
168 as&#xd;
      acquisition related costs in the line item&#xd;
      &amp;#8220;Restructuring charges&amp;#8221; on our Income&#xd;
      Statement.&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
    &lt;/div&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
      &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt&quot;&gt;Included&#xd;
      in our consolidated earnings are U-Swirl&amp;#8217;s losses&#xd;
      between January 14
 2013 and February 28
 2013 of&#xd;
      $(320
446).&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;

            &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal&quot;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;/td&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;/tr&gt;&#xd;
        &lt;tr&gt;&#xd;
          &lt;td valign=&quot;bottom&quot; width=&quot;81%&quot;&gt;&#xd;
            &lt;div style=&quot;LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt&quot; align=&quot;justify&quot;&gt;&#xd;
              &lt;font style=&quot;DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal&quot;&gt;Liabilities&#xd;

 bearer) to receive interest at an established maturity date
 based upon a fixed interest rate.  A certificate of deposit may be issued in any denomination. Certificates of deposit are generally issued by commercial banks and
 therefore
 insured by the FDIC (up to the prescribed limit).  Certificates of deposit generally restrict holders from withdrawing funds on demand without the incurrence of penalties.  Generally
 only certificates of deposit with original maturities of three months or less qualify as cash equivalents. Original maturity means original maturity to the entity holding the investment. As a related example
 both a three-month US Treasury bill and a three-year Treasury note purchased three months from maturity qualify as cash equivalents. However
 a Treasury note purchased three-years ago does not become a cash equivalent when its remaining maturity is three months.
              
 -Paragraph 8

 (b) whose operating results are regularly reviewed by the enterprise's chief operating decision maker to make decisions about resources to be allocated to the segment and assess its performance

 the valuation and qualifying accounts that are either netted against the cost of an asset (in order to value it at its carrying value) or that reflect a liability established to represent expected future costs
 representing receivables written off as uncollectible and portions of the reserves utilized
 respectively.
